content.question: An ellipse is given by the equation <math alttext="x squared over 9 plus y squared over 81 equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>81</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. Which of the following is a parametrization of the ellipse for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 2 pi"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 3 cos t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>cos</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 9 sin t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

<math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 9 cos t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><mi>cos</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 81 sin t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>81</mn><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

<math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 9 cos t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><mi>cos</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 3 sin t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

<math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 81 cos t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>81</mn><mi>cos</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 9 sin t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 3 cos t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>cos</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 9 sin t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
